physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Headaches, persistent galactorrhea, asymmetrical superior bitemporal quadrantic visual field defect.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Postoperatively, the patient's complaints of headaches, galactorrhea, and oligomenorrhea resolved.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Plasma cortisol 35 nmol/L; Prolactin 84 mg/L; LH, FSH < 1 mIU/L; GH 0.1 mg/L.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Rapidly progressive frontal headaches, nausea, vomiting, anorexia, weight loss, and cold and hot flashes. MRI revealed a 1.9-cm sellar mass with suprasellar extension.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Headaches returned 6 months later and MRI showed recurrence of the lesion. After corticosteroid treatment, MRI showed complete resolution.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Oligomenorrhea and hyperprolactinemia. MRI revealed a 1-cm inhomogeneous lesion suggestive of a cyst.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Postoperatively, the patient's PRL levels normalized. Two years later, she continues to have normal pituitary function.
